list_definition_mean.definition: to move backwards or in the opposite direction to normal
ex_of_definition_list: He reversed (the car) into the garage
He reversed the film through the projector.

list_definition_mean.definition: to put into the opposite position, state, order etc
ex_of_definition_list: This jacket can be reversed (= worn inside out).

list_definition_mean.definition: to change (a decision, policy etc) to the exact opposite
ex_of_definition_list: The man was found guilty, but the judges in the appeal court reversed the decision.

list_definition_mean.definition: (also adjective) (the) opposite
ex_of_definition_list: ‘Are you hungry?’ ‘Quite the reverse – I’ve eaten far too much!’
I take the reverse point of view.

list_definition_mean.definition: a defeat; a piece of bad luck
ex_of_definition_list: Liverpool suffered a 3-0 reverse.

list_definition_mean.definition: (a mechanism eg one of the gears of a car etc which makes something move in) a backwards direction or a direction opposite to normal
ex_of_definition_list: He put the car into reverse
(also adjective) a reverse gear.

list_definition_mean.definition: (also adjective) (of) the back of a coin, medal etc
ex_of_definition_list: the reverse (side) of a coin.

list_definition_mean.definition: a person who reviews books etc
ex_of_definition_list: a film reviewer.

list_definition_mean.definition: a written report on a book, play etc giving the writer’s opinion of it
ex_of_definition_list: a film/book review.

list_definition_mean.definition: an inspection of troops etc.
revision; studying or going over one’s notes
ex_of_definition_list: I have just enough time for a quick review of my speech
I made a quick review of my notes before the test.

list_definition_mean.definition: to make or have a review of
ex_of_definition_list: The book was reviewed in yesterday’s paper
The Queen reviewed the troops.

list_definition_mean.definition: to reconsider
ex_of_definition_list: We’ll review the situation at the end of the month.

list_definition_mean.definition: to revise; to go over one’s notes, lessons etc in preparation for an examination
ex_of_definition_list: I have to review (my notes) for the test tomorrow.

list_definition_mean.definition: to come, or bring, back to consciousness, strength, health etc
ex_of_definition_list: They attempted to revive the woman who had fainted
She soon revived
The flowers revived in water
His hopes of seeing her again were revived.

list_definition_mean.definition: to come or bring back to use etc
ex_of_definition_list: This old custom has recently (been) revived.

list_definition_mean.definition: (the act of making) a successful, violent attempt to change or remove a government etc
ex_of_definition_list: the American Revolution.

list_definition_mean.definition: a complete change in ideas, methods etc
ex_of_definition_list: There’s been a complete revolution in the way things are done in this office.

list_definition_mean.definition: a complete circle or turn round a central point, axis etc (eg as made by a record turning on a record-player, or the Earth moving on its axis or round the Sun).
a type of pistol
ex_of_definition_list: She shot him with a revolver.

list_definition_mean.definition: something given in return for or got from work done, good behaviour/behavior etc
ex_of_definition_list: He was given a gold watch as a reward for his services to the firm
Apart from the salary, teaching children has its own particular rewards.

list_definition_mean.definition: a sum of money offered for finding a criminal, lost or stolen property etc
ex_of_definition_list: A reward of $100 has been offered to the person who finds the diamond brooch.

list_definition_mean.definition: to give a reward to someone for something
ex_of_definition_list: He was rewarded for his services
His services were rewarded.

list_mean: khả năng hát có nhịp điệu

list_definition_mean.definition: a regular, repeated pattern of sounds, stresses or beats in music, poetry etc
ex_of_definition_list: Just listen to the rhythm of those drums
complicated rhythms.

list_definition_mean.definition: a regular, repeated pattern of movements
ex_of_definition_list: The rowers lost their rhythm.

list_definition_mean.mean_english: khả năng hát có nhịp điệu
list_definition_mean.definition: an ability to sing, move etc with rhythm
ex_of_definition_list: That girl has got rhythm.

list_definition_mean.definition: a long narrow strip of material used in decorating clothes, tying hair etc
ex_of_definition_list: a blue ribbon
four metres of red ribbon.

list_definition_mean.definition: any one of the bones which curve round and forward from the backbone, enclosing the heart and lungs
ex_of_definition_list: She suffered a broken rib in the accident.

list_definition_mean.definition: one of the curved pieces of wood which are joined to the keel to form the framework of a boat.
a vertical raised strip in eg knitted material, or the pattern formed by a row of these.
any of a number of things similar in shape, use etc to a rib, eg one of the supports for the fabric of an aeroplane wing or of an umbrella.
a plant, grown in well-watered ground in tropical countries, whose seeds are used as food
ex_of_definition_list: fried rice.

list_definition_mean.definition: wealthy; having a lot of money, possessions etc
ex_of_definition_list: a rich man/country.

list_definition_mean.definition: (with in) having a lot (of something)
ex_of_definition_list: This part of the country is rich in coal.

list_definition_mean.definition: valuable
ex_of_definition_list: a rich reward
rich materials.

list_definition_mean.definition: containing a lot of fat, eggs, spices etc
ex_of_definition_list: a rich sauce.

list_definition_mean.definition: (of clothes, material etc) very beautiful and expensive.
to travel or be carried (in a car, train etc or on a bicycle, horse etc)
ex_of_definition_list: He rides to work every day on an old bicycle
The horsemen rode past.

list_definition_mean.definition: to (be able to) ride on and control (a horse, bicycle etc)

list_definition_mean.definition: to take part (in a horse-race etc)
ex_of_definition_list: He’s riding in the first race.

list_definition_mean.definition: to go out regularly on horseback (eg as a hobby)

list_definition_mean.definition: a journey on horseback, on a bicycle etc
ex_of_definition_list: He likes to go for a long ride on a Sunday afternoon.

list_definition_mean.definition: a usually short period of riding on or in something
ex_of_definition_list: Can I have a ride on your bike?

list_definition_mean.definition: a gun with a long barrel, fired from the shoulder
ex_of_definition_list: The soldiers are being taught to shoot with rifles.

list_definition_mean.definition: to search (through something)
ex_of_definition_list: The thief rifled through the drawers.

list_definition_mean.definition: to steal
ex_of_definition_list: The document had been rifled.

list_definition_mean.definition: on or related to the side of the body which in most people has the more skilful hand, or to the side of a person or thing which is toward the east when that person or thing is facing north (opposite to left)
ex_of_definition_list: When I’m writing, I hold my pen in my right hand.

list_definition_mean.definition: correct
ex_of_definition_list: Put that book back in the right place
Is that the right answer to the question?

list_definition_mean.definition: morally correct; good
ex_of_definition_list: It’s not right to let thieves keep what they have stolen.

list_definition_mean.definition: suitable; appropriate
ex_of_definition_list: He’s not the right man for this job
When would be the right time to ask him?

list_definition_mean.definition: something a person is, or ought to be, allowed to have, do etc
ex_of_definition_list: Everyone has the right to a fair trial
You must fight for your rights
You have no right to say that.

list_definition_mean.definition: that which is correct or good
ex_of_definition_list: Who’s in the right in this argument?

list_definition_mean.definition: the right side, part or direction
ex_of_definition_list: Turn to the right
Take the second road on the right.

list_definition_mean.definition: in politics, the people, group, party or parties holding the more traditional beliefs etc
ex_of_definition_list: the extreme right.

list_definition_mean.definition: exactly
ex_of_definition_list: He was standing right here.

list_definition_mean.definition: immediately
ex_of_definition_list: I’ll go right after lunch
I’ll come right down.

list_definition_mean.definition: close
ex_of_definition_list: He was standing right beside me.

list_definition_mean.definition: completely; all the way
ex_of_definition_list: The bullet went right through his arm.

list_definition_mean.definition: to the right
ex_of_definition_list: Turn right.

list_definition_mean.definition: correctly
ex_of_definition_list: Have I done that right?
I don’t think this sum is going to turn out right.

list_definition_mean.mean_english: lấy lại cho thẳng (hướng đi của ô tô, tàu thủy…)
list_definition_mean.definition: to bring back to the correct, usually upright, position
ex_of_definition_list: The boat tipped over, but righted itself again.

list_definition_mean.definition: to put an end to and make up for something wrong that has been done
ex_of_definition_list: He’s like a medieval knight, going about the country looking for wrongs to right.

list_definition_mean.definition: I understand; I’ll do what you say etc
ex_of_definition_list: ‘I want you to type some letters for me.’ ‘Right, I’ll do them now.’

list_definition_mean.definition: an edge or border
ex_of_definition_list: the rim of a wheel
the rim of a cup.

list_definition_mean.definition: to wash (clothes etc) in clean water to remove soap etc
ex_of_definition_list: He was rinsing a plate under the tap.

list_definition_mean.definition: to clean (a cup, one’s mouth etc) by filling with clean water etc and then emptying the water out
ex_of_definition_list: The dentist asked me to rinse my mouth out.

list_definition_mean.definition: the act of rinsing
ex_of_definition_list: Give the cup a rinse.

list_definition_mean.definition: a liquid used for changing the colour of hair
ex_of_definition_list: a blue rinse.

list_definition_mean.definition: a noisy disturbance created by a usually large group of people
ex_of_definition_list: The protest march developed into a riot.

list_definition_mean.definition: to form or take part in a riot
ex_of_definition_list: The protesters were rioting in the street.

list_definition_mean.definition: to make or get a hole or tear in by pulling, tearing etc
ex_of_definition_list: He ripped his shirt on a branch
His shirt ripped.

list_definition_mean.definition: to pull (off, up etc) by breaking or tearing
ex_of_definition_list: The roof of the car was ripped off in the crash
to rip up floorboards

list_definition_mean.definition: a tear or hole
ex_of_definition_list: a rip in my shirt.

list_definition_mean.definition: to become greater, larger, higher etc; to increase
ex_of_definition_list: Food prices are still rising
His temperature rose

Her voice rose to a scream
Bread rises when it is baked
His spirits rose at the good news.

list_definition_mean.definition: to move upwards
ex_of_definition_list: Smoke was rising from the chimney
The birds rose into the air
The curtain rose to reveal an empty stage.

list_definition_mean.definition: to get up from bed
ex_of_definition_list: He rises every morning at six o’clock.

list_definition_mean.definition: to stand up
ex_of_definition_list: The children all rose when the headmaster came in.

list_definition_mean.definition: (of the sun etc) to appear above the horizon
ex_of_definition_list: The sun rises in the east and sets in the west.

list_definition_mean.definition: to slope upwards
ex_of_definition_list: Hills rose in the distance
The ground rises at this point.

list_definition_mean.definition: to rebel
ex_of_definition_list: The people rose (up) in revolt against the dictator.

list_definition_mean.definition: to move to a higher rank, a more important position etc
ex_of_definition_list: He rose to the rank of colonel.

list_definition_mean.definition: (of a river) to begin or appear
ex_of_definition_list: The Rhône rises in the Alps.

list_definition_mean.definition: (of wind) to begin; to become stronger
ex_of_definition_list: Don’t go out in the boat – the wind has risen.

list_definition_mean.definition: to be built
ex_of_definition_list: Office blocks are rising all over the town.

list_definition_mean.definition: to come back to life
ex_of_definition_list: Jesus has risen.

list_definition_mean.definition: an increase in salary or wages
ex_of_definition_list: She asked her boss for a rise.

list_definition_mean.definition: a slope or hill
ex_of_definition_list: The house is just beyond the next rise.

list_definition_mean.definition: the beginning and early development of something

list_definition_mean.definition: possibly causing or bringing loss, injury etc

list_definition_mean.definition: the ground beside a road
ex_of_definition_list: flowers growing by the roadside

list_definition_mean.definition: the part of a road on which cars etc travel

list_definition_mean.definition: a strip of ground usually with a hard level surface for people, vehicles etc to travel on

list_definition_mean.definition: (often abbreviated to Rdwhen written) used in the names of roads or streets

list_definition_mean.definition: a route; the correct road(s) to follow in order to arrive somewhere
